text: Beary language is an Indian language. It is spoken by the Muslim communities of Karnataka (Dakshina Kannada and Udupi districts) and some parts of Kerala., p. ix Bearys speak a language made of Malayalam idioms (form of expression of a language) with Tulu pronunciation and grammar. The first Beary language feature movie (full length movie) Byari shared the award for the best feature movie at the 59th Indian National Film Awards.Here's why Byari won the National Award for Best Film. Rediff.com (7 March 2012). Retrieved on 2017-04-26. ==Notes== ==References== * Category:Languages of India Category:Dravidian languages
title: Beary language
